title: Liver cirrhosis deaths : Canada 2002 , 2012 , and 2016
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Male, and Female. The y axis indicates the Deaths per 100000 popultation and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Male, and Female are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Male, and lastly, 2. Female.
Overall across the Year, Male mostly maintained the highest Deaths per 100000 popultation when compared to others with a mean value of 10.63, and it peaked at 2016.
The botommost line, Female,  has a mean of 5.0, and peaked at 2016.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Male, and Female. The y axis indicates the Deaths per 100000 popultation and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Male, and Female are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Deaths per 100000 popultation in descending order is: 1. Male, and lastly, 2. Female.
Throughout the period, Male generally had the highest Deaths per 100000 popultation relative to others with an average of 10.63, and it reached its maximum at 2016 with a value of 10.9.
The botommost line, Female,  has a mean of 5.0, and peaked at 2016.
The minimum Deaths per 100000 popultation about 4.7, occured at 2002 by Female.
The difference of Deaths per 100000 popultation between Male and Female is roughly same at Year 2016 compared to the Year 2002.
